column3: Uncore cache clock ticks

M line evictions from LLC (writebacks to memory)
LLC misses - demand and prefetch data reads - excludes LLC prefetches
LLC misses - Uncacheable reads (from cpu)
MMIO reads
MMIO writes

LLC prefetch misses for code reads

LLC misses for PCIe read current
ItoM write misses (as part of fast string memcpy stores) + PCIe full line writes
PCIe write misses (full cache line)
PCIe writes (partial cache line)
L2 demand and L2 prefetch code references to LLC
Streaming stores (full cache line)
Streaming stores (partial cache line)
PCIe read current
PCIe write references (full cache line)
Occupancy counter for LLC data reads (demand and L2 prefetch)

write requests to remote home agent
Conflict requests (requests for same address from multiple agents simultaneously)

M line forwarded from remote cache with no writeback to memory

Shared line forwarded from remote cache

Memory controller clock ticks
Cycles where DRAM ranks are in power down (CKE) mode
Cycles all ranks are in critical thermal throttle
Cycles Memory is in self refresh power mode
Pre-charges due to page misses
Pre-charge for reads
Pre-charge for writes
QPI clock ticks
Number of data flits transmitted
Number of non data (control) flits transmitted
PCU clock ticks. Use to get percentages of PCU cycles events.

This is an occupancy event that tracks the number of cores that are in C0.  It can be used by itself to get the average number of cores in C0, with threshholding to generate histograms, or with other PCU events and occupancy triggering to capture other details.

This is an occupancy event that tracks the number of cores that are in C3.  It can be used by itself to get the average number of cores in C0, with threshholding to generate histograms, or with other PCU events and occupancy triggering to capture other details.

This is an occupancy event that tracks the number of cores that are in C6.  It can be used by itself to get the average number of cores in C0, with threshholding to generate histograms, or with other PCU events

Counts the number of cycles that we are in external PROCHOT mode.  This mode is triggered when a sensor off the die determines that something off-die (like DRAM) is too hot and must throttle to avoid damaging the chip.
Counts the number of cycles when temperature is the upper limit on frequency.
Counts the number of cycles when the OS is the upper limit on frequency.
Counts the number of cycles when power is the upper limit on frequency.
Counts the number of cycles when current is the upper limit on frequency.
